sentence: In other news … Marjorie Taylor Greene and Paul Gosar, members of Congress who spoke at a white nationalist event in Florida this week, are “morons” with no place in the Republican party, Mitt Romney said yesterday.

title: First Thing: Russian rouble crashes as sanctions make their mark

sentence: Sen. Mitt Romney (R-Utah) offered this on CNN Sunday: “You know, Marjorie Taylor Greene and Paul Gosar, I don't know them, but I'm reminded of that old line for the Butch Cassidy the Sundance Kid movie where one character says, 'Morons, I've got morons on my team.’” More from The Atlanta Journal Constitution and The Wall Street Journal.
title: Fence up, masks off at the Capitol

sentence: AFPAC also featured prerecorded speeches from Rep. Paul Gosar of Arizona and Idaho Lt.

title: Nick Fuentes praises 'thinly veiled racism' of GOP attacks on Ketanji Brown Jackson

sentence: Also, Romney referred to Greene and Rep. Paul Gosar, R-Ariz., as “morons” for attending a conference put on by a white supremacist where people cheered for Russian President Vladimir Putin after the invasion of Ukraine.

title: Mitt Romney’s support of Ketanji Brown Jackson unleashes conservative vitriol

sentence: Jerod MacDonald-Evoy @ The Arizona Mirror: Paul Gosar promoted appearing at a white nationalist social gathering on Hitler’s birthday, but his campaign says he isn’t.

title: Right Wing Round-Up: Confirmed

sentence: Greene recently escaped meaningful rebuke from Republican leaders when she and Rep. Paul Gosar spoke at a white nationalist event.

title: Jimmy Kimmel claps back after Marjorie Taylor Greene says she reported his joke to the police

sentence: Right now, hearing Donald Trump’s name almost exclusively tied to legal actions doesn’t bug one nearly as much as hearing the droning dirge of bigotries from people like Marjorie Taylor Greene or Paul Gosar.
title: News Roundup: A moment of true history worth being alive for

sentence: Her colleagues in the House include Paul Gosar and Matt Gaetz and Lauren Boebert and Louie Gohmert and, sigh, many more.

title: Is There Any Way To Isolate Political Extremists? Yes
